[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][IMG]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/Title240.png[/IMG][/align]

[align=center]The edition you are currently reading is the [color=white][b]#240th edition[/b] of the HF News[/color]. To read any older editions of the HF News, please go [url=http://bitly.com/1FnhESq]here[/url].[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/Headlines.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Xch4ng3 Returns[/color][/b]
After stepping down as Administrator followed by a short stay with the Mentors, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=65784][color=#9999FF][b]Xch4ng3[/b][/color][/url] has rejoined the forum team as Staff. We would like to thank [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=65784][color=#9999FF][b]Xch4ng3[/b][/color][/url] for his remarkable dedication and hard work here on Hack Forums, which goes back to early 2011. 

[b][color=white]Mysterious New Awards[/color][/b]
A puzzling set of awards has been added to the awards list. The green, purple, and gold Clover trio holds no clear requirements for obtaining them as of now; only that they appear to be for the [i]lucky[/i] members.  Members are speculating a casino-like project is underway, but [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has not confirmed this, saying only they are in "Teaser" - the stage previous to Beta - mode. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4818053&pid=46113699#pid46113699]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4818029][b]Omnicoin Group Auction[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Omniscient talks about his plans to resume the Omnicoin group auction in the near future.

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4823197][b]How many murders are on HF?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1352219][b][color=#00AAFF]SprayPaint[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Do you believe there are murderers on Hack Forums? This user does.

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4817794][b]1 year+ in depth feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2672071][b][color=#EFEFEF]Joshz[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The user Joshz gives his feedback regarding Hack Forums in this thread. Check it out!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4819617][b]1 Year HF Bday Thread + Feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2289596][b][color=#00AAFF]Limited Edition[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The user Limited Edition gives his feedback regarding Hack Forums in this thread. Check it out!

[b][color=white][u]Contests & Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4817076][b]1.2 btc giveaway![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2656688][b][color=#99FF00]Young Nino[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]How would you like to win 1.2 bitcoins? Enter this contest to test your luck at it!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4817582][b]$35 3 WINNERS // AND MENTORSHIP[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2231695][b][color=#EFEFEF]+One[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Three users have the chance to win $35 in this contest and you could be one of them. Hurry and enter now!

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/InterviewClique.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][color=black][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937]angel.[/url][/color][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to this weeks edition of the HF news. This time we're joined with angel. What's up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] Yo what's good, Clique?

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Doing just fine man. Any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] Shoutout to all the basement dwellers that watch anime; yes I'm talking about Gladly, Emp, Package, and especially Prada.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] What's a day in the life of angel. like? What do you do outside of the internet?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] I actually just completed my junior year of college and barring any setbacks will become a senior next year. Since I'm a Computer Science undergrad, I spend a good amount of my free time coding in some form or another. Other than that, I play on an intramural indoor soccer team and have for the past three years of college. I also like to get drunk on the weekends. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Besides going on HF, what else do you do when you're on the internet?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] Well HF is really the only forum I frequently browse and post on but I do play a ton of Xbox, mainly CoD. I'm sure as you can tell by my avatar, I enjoy watching anime and reading manga (my favorite being Gossip Girls). I also like to browse dank memes, casually touch myself to hentai, and watch Filthy Frank videos. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] How did you even find out about HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] I registered way back in 2012 after hearing about the gamertag market from some random guys on Xbox. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] What's different about HackForums compared to the countless other online forums out there? Is it the activity?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] Honestly, nothing much. I guess the community I've become accustomed to is part of the reason but other than that, I can't really think of anything. Well I guess on most forums you don't see people spending $7k on a group so that's certainly different. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] What is your opinion about anime?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] Some people hate and some people love it. If I had to choose, I would be somewhere in the middle. Yes, I watch a lot of anime but I definitely see why a good amount of people hate it. Usually, anime communities come off as extremely weird or perverse but that's just me generalizing. Every group will have outliers and the anime community is no different. If you want even a slight chance of having a remotely normal social life, please don't talk about anime irl.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Has HF changed back in 2012 when you first signed up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] For the little time that I've actually been active, HF as a whole has seen some major changes. I feel like the overall quality of the community is on the decline and will eventually die off one day. Even so, Omni has been making some big changes to the overall functionality of the site and I feel like every little thing he adds helps in its own way. 

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for letting me interview you for this week, any final words?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937][color=white][b]angel.:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for the opportunity, it's been a pleasure. And if Emp would stop bullying me on online forums, that would be wonderful.  
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/GroupNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Fortune sold - with a hint of dishonesty[/color][/b]
Official group Fortune has been sold to [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=497949][color=#00AAFF][b]eCoLoGy[/b][/color][/url] by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2370059][color=#00AAFF][b]PositiveEnergy[/b][/color][/url]. Many speculate that the deal was made in lieu of [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4821230&pid=46132202#pid46132202]PositiveEnergy's diminishing funds[/url], but there has been no hard evidence to support this claim. As for the new group, eCoLoGy has made mention of a "user-interaction" group, most likely meaning that he'll be heading in the direction of a lounge group with no main focus or theme (can I hear a "Long Live The Empire"). However, not everything is as clean cut as it seems. A recent report by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=923753][color=#EFEFEF][b]Juicy-[/b][/color][/url] calls out PositiveEnergy for [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4821331]potentially executing an exit scam[/url]. PositiveEnergy [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4821331&pid=46134299#pid46134299]has responded[/url] as of Friday with a promise to pay back whatever he owes.

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/OmnicoinNews.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]Omnicoin Price Triples After Auction Announcement[/b][/color]
Earlier this week [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4818029]announced[/url] that the official group auction with Omnicoin will indeed be returning. The past auction was delayed and eventually cancelled due to an attack against AllCrypt, the only Omnicoin exchange, and the Omnicoin network itself. 

This announcement caused a rush of demand on [url=https://bittrex.com/Market/Index?MarketName=BTC-OMC]Bittrex[/url], causing the price to triple in value in just a few hours. The auction will most likely take place later this month, ending in early June.

You can read more about it [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4818029]here[/url].

[/list]

[*][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4824652][b][$7=CHEAPEST ON HF] {DISCOUNT WITH CRYPTO} == PAYPAL XPLODER == [$100s ON AUTOPILOT][/b][/url] by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1612332]Dan Smith[/url]
[/list]

posts.subject: HF News // Edition 240

posts.message:
[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]The VENOM Vulnerability[/b][/color]
A new vulnerability has come to light pertaining to several virtualization platforms and has been dubbed [b]VENOM[/b] ([b]V[/b]irtualized [b]E[/b]nvironments [b]N[/b]eglected [b]O[/b]perations [b]M[/b]anipulation). The vulnerability resides in the virtual Floppy Disk Controller (FDC) of the QEMU hypervisor package that is utilized in many very popular hypervisors such as Xenserver and KVM. The FDC allows the virtual host to communicate with the host machine's resources, including other virtual hosts, and a small buffer overflow vulnerability allows a malicious attacker to break out of the VM and access not only other VM's, but also the host controller's hardware, allowing it to connect to networks that the host is attached to, allowing it to perform lateral attacks to other machines on the host network. This is especially dangerous if, for example, the host is in a production network, but the VM's are in a DMZ, because this would allow a hacker to access production data and launch further attacks. Patches have been released by RedHat and Citrix (Xen).

[color=white][b]Yet Another Microsoft Word Exploit[/b][/color]
Word Macros have long-since been the vector of choice when attacking Office users. A new vector utilizing an old method has come to light, and it is undetectable by AV's. Saving a Macro-infested .Docx file as an MHTML document, and changing the extension to .doc(x) or by appending base64-encoded data via an MSO file will hide the macros from antiviruses. The reason it is new is that it uses a new format, MHTML. Luckily, AV's are catching on quickly to this vector and have added signature-based rules to induce detection of these hidden devils. The payload was distributed via spam email explaining to the victim that their order has been shipped. A curious receiver, who had not ordered anything, would likely be inclined to open the attached invoice, which is the malicious .doc file, and see what all the fuss was about. Until recently, their AV's would not have suspected anything. Of course, the user would have to enable macros, but less technologically savvy people would follow the instructions without so much as a google search to see if it was safe. You can find the original and deobfuscated macro [url=http://pastebin.com/wryUwym8]here[/url].

[color=white][b]MacKeeper 0-day Exploit[/b][/color]
MacKeeper is a software for Mac OS X that is made to clean and secure a computer system. The vulnerability let's the attacker execute malicious commands with admin privileges on Mac OS X systems when a specific web page is visited. The vulnerability affects any MacKeeper that is under the version of 3.4.1. That is because of the way MacKeeper malware removal handles it's custom URL's. If the user has not logged on to MacKeeper then the login screen will appear and the login will be part of the exploit which the user will not be aware of which then will result in the user giving access to the hacker. The vulnerability has been fixed on any version of MacKeeper that is higher than 3.4.1. The vulnerability could have put many users at risk if it wasn't handle properly. No known breaches with the exploits are known of at MacKeeper. This exploit runs a certain command and then goes onto uninstalling MacKeeper once the certain web page containing this 0-day exploit is visited. This exploit gives the attacker remote access to the system.

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/SecurityNews.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]United Awards Miles to Those Who Discoverer System Bugs[/b][/color]
United Airline has announced that will begin offering a bounty program for bugs found within their system. Many massive companies such as Google, Facebook, and Microsoft already offer a bounty program, and it looks like United wants to join the ranks. United said, "We believe that this program will further bolster our security and allow us to continue to provide excellent service. If you think you have discovered a potential bug that affects our websites, apps and/or online portals, please let us know. If the submission meets our requirements, we'll gladly reward you for your time and effort." Their program currently offers between 50,000 and 1,000,000 miles as a reward for exploit. United considers bugs that affect "confidentiality, integrity and/or availability of customer or company information" as potential bases for a reward. United said low severity vulnerabilities, things such as third-party issues affecting United, are worth 50,000 miles. Medium severity vulnerabilities, such as those that could lead to exposure of personal information, are worth 250,000 miles per vulnerability. Finally, high security vulnerabilities, such as those related to remote code execution are worth up to 1,000,000 miles. Security researchers must be MileagePlus embers to submit a vulnerability. Strangely, the company also said vulnerabilities that affect their on-board WiFi, on-board entertainment, and avionics are not applicable for these reward. [i][size=xx-small][url=http://www.cnet.com/news/united-airlines-will-award-miles-in-bug-bounty-program/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Penn State Security Breach Leaks 18,000 Peoples' Passwords[/b][/color]
Pennsylvania State University's College of Engineering revealed on Friday that they had been targeted by two "highly sophisticated" cyber attacks over the last two years. The University's President, Eric Barron, issued an apology Friday that stating that the username and passwords of over 18,000 people may have been accessed. Fortunately, investigators believe that there was no breach of credit card information. In a different statement, Barron said that based on information from a security contractor hired by the school to investigate the attacks, at least one of the attacks originated from China. In his statement, Barron included, "We all will need to take additional steps to protect ourselves, our identities and our information from a new global wave of cybercrime and cyberespionage. Well-funded and highly skilled cyber criminals have become brazen in their attacks on a wide range of businesses and government agencies, likely in search of sensitive information and intellectual property." Penn State is one of many US colleges to have suffered a successful cyber attack. The University of California, LA, the University or Southern California, and the University of Maryland has all suffered similar attacks, that have exposed information on hundreds of thousands of people. Barron said on average Penn State "repels" more than 22 million cyber attacks from all around the world every day. [i][size=xx-small][url=http://www.cnet.com/news/penn-state-cyberattack-exposes-passwords-from-18k-people/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Researchers Discuss Google App Engine Vulnerabilities[/b][/color]
A group of researchers for Poland claims, there are still several outstanding vulnerabilities in the Google App Engines for Java three of which include Java sandbox escapes. After three weeks without a statement from Google, the researchers reviled the vulnerabilities as well as proof of concept code. The code provided doesn't break the sandbox, but allows for a partial GAE bypass and could allow one to gain access to GAE's Java environment. The researchers said that the vulnerabilities stem mostly from an incorrect implementation of several methods and missing security checks in the Ape Engine. Security Explorations', the security researchers' company, CEO, Adam Gowdiak, said, “It should not take more than 1-2 business days for a major software vendor to run the received POC, read our report and/or consult the source code. This especially concerns the vendor that claims its Security Team has hundreds of security engineers from all over the world." He went on to say that several proof-of-concept-codes that he sent to Google stopped working in a production version of GAE, however, he said Google is yet to confirm the vulnerability was fixed. Gowdiak says that this would be the third time Google silently patched vulnerabilities. [i][size=xx-small][url=https://threatpost.com/researchers-disclose-further-vulnerabilities-in-google-app-engine/112849]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[b][color=white]Famous Dreamcast RPG Coming to Steam
[/color][/b]GungHo Online Entertainment will be bringing the classic role-playing game [i]Grandia II[/i], originally published on the Sega Dreamcast in 2000, to Steam for the Windows PC following enthusiastic feedback from a survey taken in April. The game will be supporting both Steam achievements and trading cards. The game has been updated with HD graphics along with both mouse, keyboard, and gamepad support. "With the rise of digital downloads, it is especially important that classic games continue to remain available to play in some form," said president of GungHo America Jun Iwasaki. "Grandia II was chosen for a PC re-release because it represents both a hallmark of the Grandia series and an example of how great JRPGs can be." [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/acclaimed-dreamcast-rpg-grandia-ii-coming-to-steam/1100-6427252/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Free [i]Hearthstone[/i] Card Packs for European Players[/color][/b]
Two classic [i]Hearthstone[/i] card packs are being distributed for free to players in the European Hearthstone region. These card packs come as an apology for bad connectivity in the region throughout last week. This announcement comes from the official [i]Hearthstone[/i] blog, which can be found [url=http://eu.battle.net/hearthstone/en/blog/19085491/update-for-hearthstone-players-in-europe-11-05-2015]here[/url]. "We know access to Hearthstone in Europe was spotty last week," according to the post. "Sorry about that, and we really appreciate your patience as we worked to get the tavern back into shape. "As a thank-you for bearing with us, all Hearthstone accounts in the European Hearthstone region created prior to May 3, 2015 will enjoy two free Classic Hearthstone card packs, free of charge." The packs won’t be set to expire and will show up in the “Open Packs” section and have an expected delivery time of 24 hours. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.polygon.com/2015/5/12/8590559/blizzard-says-sorry-to-euro-hearthstone-players-with-free-card-packs]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white][i]Ratchet & Clank[/i] Won’t Appear on the Playstation 4 Until 2016[/color][/b]
The remake of the original game in the [i]Ratchet & Clank[/i] Playstation series, which was set to be released sometime this year, has now been announced to be released in the spring of 2016. This news came from Insomniac brand development director Ryan Schneider on the official Playstation Blog on May 13. A feature animated film based on the [i]Ratchet & Clank[/i] game series has been given a release date of April 29, 2016, with the Playstation 4 game being expected to be released around the same time. According to Schneider, the Playstation 4 version of [i]Ratchet & Clank[/i] "re-tells the origin story that ties in closely and expands upon the movie's narrative." Schneider says the game will also feature new levels, new weapons and "completely redone visuals." The original [i]Ratchet & Clank[/i] was released on the Sony Playstation 2 in 2002, with the most recent installment of the series being 2013's [i]Ratchet & Clank: Into the Nexus[/i] for PlayStation 3. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.polygon.com/2015/5/13/8603465/ratchet-clank-ps4-release-date]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/TechNews.png[/img][/align]

[align=left][color=white][b]World's First 6TB SSD Coming Very Soon[/b][/color]
Can't pick between the large space of an HDD or the speediness of an SSD? Well, turns out you won't have to - for long. Japanese electronics company Fixstar has announced that they will be releasing a line of SSDs in flavors of 1TB, 3TB, and the monstrous 6TB. The drives will come at a hefty price, with the only announced price being for the 1TB variety which will retail at $820 USD. The 6TB drive will be capable of handling write speeds of 520 Megabytes per second, and a read speed of 540 Megabytes per second, while only being 2.5 inches long.  [size=xx-small][url=http://www.geek.com/chips/worlds-first-6tb-ssd-will-be-available-to-buy-in-july-1622377/][i]>>Source[/i][/url][/size]

[color=white][b]Galaxy S6 and S6 Edge Getting "Iron Man Edition"[/b][/color]
In a cross promotion with Samsung, Marvel has decided to add a little Avengers flavor to the Smartphone world. Iron Man color-schemed versions of Samsung's Galaxy S6 line are expected to be released this June. As of yet, Samsung has not announced whether the release will be solely abroad, or if it will hit the west. Images of the alleged design can be found [url=http://forums.androidcentral.com/samsung-galaxy-s6/498353-galaxy-s6-iron-man-edition.html]here[/url]. [size=xx-small][url=http://www.sammobile.com/2015/05/04/iron-man-versions-of-the-galaxy-s6-and-the-galaxy-s6-edge-coming-next-month/][i]>>Source[/i][/url][/size]

[color=white][b]$10k Apple Watch At 1/10 The Price[/b][/color]
With Apple's golden watch retailing anywhere from $10,000 to $17,000, Various jewelers have decided that they can do an equal job, at a fraction of Apple's five figure cost. A company that goes by the name of Watch Plate, will do the job themselves for $399, or about 25 times less than what the tech giant is asking for. While the buyer must supply the Apple Watch for the process, the price difference will continue to be enormous. Jeweler Watch Plate claims they use 24 karat rose gold as well as 24 karat yellow gold for plating the devices. They have also claimed that the entire process takes no longer than three days. [size=xx-small][url=http://9to5mac.com/2015/05/04/gold-apple-watch-diy/][i]>>Source[/i][/url][/size][/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][b]Ramadi's Battle[/b][/color]
Over 500 people have been killed in Ramadi over the last two days as Islamic State (IS) now claims it has taken over the city. Fighting first begun last year but IS recently renewed their push for the city in April, besieging the city an putting it under serious threat with suicide and car bombings. It was reported after many bombings, the police and army defending the city started to retreat leaving behind equipment. The IS has now claimed the city is under their full control saying: "God has enabled the soldiers of the caliphate to cleanse all of Ramadi." A spokesman for the regional governor confirmed the statement: "Anbar operations command has been cleared," Muhannad Haimour told the AFP news agency. We don't have an accurate count of casualties yet but we believe at least 500 people, both civilian and military, have been killed over the past two days." Although taken over, Iraq's prime minister, Haider al Abadi has sated he has Shia militia on stand-by for the retake over the unstable city. [i][size=x-small][url=http://news.sky.com/story/1485701/is-onslaught-on-ramadi-kills-500-in-two-days]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]$22 Billion In Deals Between China And India[/b][/color]
India has signed a trade agreement with China worth around $22bn in Shanghai as Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to China nears to a close. The agreement covers many sectors, including renewable energy, financial sectors, and ports. "Let us work together in mutual interests," said Mr Modi. "Now India is ready for business." Even more agreements were then signed covering education, railways, and scientific research making up $10bn of the deal. Mr. Modi's travel to China has been prosperous in creating an alliance between the two countries. During his visit Mr. Modi received a golden Buddha statue from an abbot at the Dacien temple in Xian. A statement made by China's foreign affair ministry has stated that the two countries "must work together to enhance mutual trust, control our differences and problems to avoid them interfering with bilateral relations". [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-32762930]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=white][b]Egypt Executes Six[/b][/color]
Egypt has executed six men who were convicted of carrying out attacks on soldiers last year. The men who were hanged were accused of being members of militant group Sinai Province who have pledged an alliance with Islamic State (IS). They were all found guilty of killing two officers during a gunfight in March 2014. Although the men were hanged many were asking for a retrial of the men due to the "flawed" justice system in Egypt. Two groups, Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International claimed that three of the six men were in custody at the time of the attack in Arab Sharkas, a village north of Cairo and so therefore could not have carried out the attack. Amnesty International described the trial as "grossly unfair" and said the men were even tortured into confessing to the charges. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-32771728]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center]Every week - assuming we get enough submissions - the HF News will feature the best submitted battlestation.
Send iHydra a message by clicking [url=http://hackforums.net/private.php?action=send&uid=561239&subject=HFN%20Battlestations&message=Here%20is%20my%20submission%20for%20the%20HF%20News%27%20Battlestations%20section:]here[/url] and including an imgur link of your battlestation![/align]

[align=center][b][url=https://www.reddit.com/r/battlestations/comments/369aun/black_and_white_stryker/]freshandsticky[/url]'s Battlestation[/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][img]http://i.imgur.com/5vzRlnG.png[/img][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]          [/color]

[align=center][IMG]http://ihydra.net/hfnt/headers/Moment.png[/IMG][/align]

Moment is a new section that was suggested by multiple members. Members were looking to participate in HF News and we cannot fit everyone in Writers so we will begin to allow community members to write and submit articles of their own likings. There will be restrictions listed in the next edition along with how Moment will function in regards to articles. Moment isn't just for the community-submitted articles, we will also give "shoutouts" or public thank yous to people who are of help to HF News each week. This section is all about YOU!

[b][color=white]Thank you to the following members for their continued support with HF News:[/b][/color]
